Main Page   Modules   Data Structures   File List   Data Fields  

Class Pixel group container.

Kernel ANSI C pixel group functions, last updated 7/2/2002. More...


Modules

Fast functions, no updating of boundaries!
 Optimized functions, the programmer must be sure that the code is without bugs, no checks in these functions.


Data Structures

struct  TPixelGroup
 A group of pixels found by a segmentation algorithm. More...


Functions

void k_InitGroup (TPixelGroup *pPixelGroup)
 Sets all the pointers in pPixelGroup to NULL.

void k_EmptyGroup (TPixelGroup *pPixelGroup)
 Deletes all allocated memory for PixelGroup and sets variables to 0.

void k_AllocGroup (TPixelGroup *pPixelGroup, unsigned int InitialSize)
 Allocates memory for pixel positions in the TPixelGroup structure.

void k_AllocGroupAndColors (TPixelGroup *pPixelGroup, unsigned int InitialSize)
 Same as k_AllocGroup, except that the array containing color information in the TPixelGroup structure is also allocate.

void k_ReAllocGroup (TPixelGroup *pPixelGroup, unsigned int NewSize)
 Reallocates memory for the TPixelGroup structure.

void k_AdjustSizeOfGroup (TPixelGroup *pPixelGroup)
 Removes unused memory allocated for pixel positions in the TPixelGroup structure.

bool k_AddPosToGroup (INT16 x, INT16 y, TPixelGroup *pPixelGroup)
 The position (x,y) is added to the group of pixels.

bool k_Add2DPosToGroup (T2DInt Pos, TPixelGroup *pPixelGroup)
 Same as k_AddPosToGroup(), except the position is given in a T2DInt structure.

bool k_AddPosColorToGroup (INT16 x, INT16 y, UINT32 Color, TPixelGroup *pPixelGroup)
 Same as k_AddPosition(x,y), except a color value is also inserted.

bool k_Add2DPosColorToGroup (T2DInt Pos, UINT32 Color, TPixelGroup *pPixelGroup)
 Same as AddPositionColor(x,y), except the position is given in a T2DInt structure.

UINT32 k_GetColorGroup (unsigned int Index, const TPixelGroup *pPixelGroup)
 Get the color corresponding to the position stored at "Index" in the group.

bool k_SetColorGroup (UINT32 ColorValue, unsigned int Index, TPixelGroup *pPixelGroup)
 Set the color ColorValue corresponding to the position stored at "Index" in the group.

bool k_ColorsAvailableGroup (const TPixelGroup *pPixelGroup)
 Use this method to check if colors are stored in the pixel group.

bool k_InsertPosInGroup (INT16 x, INT16 y, unsigned int Index, TPixelGroup *pPixelGroup)
 Insert the position (x,y) at given Index, which must be less than the NumberOfPixels (stored in the TPixelGroup structure).

bool k_Insert2DPosInGroup (T2DInt Pos, unsigned int Index, TPixelGroup *pPixelGroup)
 Same as k_InsertPosInGroup, except the position is given in a T2DInt structure.

bool k_InsertPosColorInGroup (INT16 x, INT16 y, UINT32 Color, unsigned int Index, TPixelGroup *pPixelGroup)
 Same as k_InsertPosInGroup(x,y), except a color value is also inserted.

bool k_Insert2DPosColorInGroup (T2DInt Pos, UINT32 Color, unsigned int Index, TPixelGroup *pPixelGroup)
 Same as InsertPositionColor(x,y), except the position is given in a T2DInt structure.

bool k_RemovePosFromGroup (unsigned int Index, TPixelGroup *pPixelGroup)
 Remove a position stored in the group at given index.

bool k_RemovePosFromGroupSlow (unsigned int Index, TPixelGroup *pPixelGroup)
 Same as k_RemovePosFromGroup, but the ordering of the pixels is preserved.

unsigned int k_RemoveDuplicatesFromGroup (TPixelGroup *pPixelGroup)
 Removes duplicates of same position in given pixelgroup.

bool k_AllocColorsGroup (TPixelGroup *pPixelGroup)
 Allocates cells for color values but does not initialize the values.

bool k_AllocAndInitColorsGroup (UINT32 InitialValue, TPixelGroup *pPixelGroup)
 Same as k_AllocColorsGroup but here the initial value of the allocated cells can be specified.

void k_CopyGroup (TPixelGroup *pDest, const TPixelGroup *pSource)
 Copy whole group from "pSource" to "pDest".

bool k_AddColorsToGroup (const TImage *pSource, TPixelGroup *pPixelGroup)
 After the creation of a PixelGroup this function will get the original pixel colors from given source image and insert them into the PixelGroup.

void k_RemoveColors (TPixelGroup *pPixelGroup)
 Remove colors stored in the TPixelGroup.

bool k_CopyGroupToImage (TPalette *pPalette, UINT32 BackGround, TImage *pDest, TPixelGroup *pPixelGroup)
 Copies a pixel group to a new image.

bool k_AddGroupToImage (TImage *pDest, const TPixelGroup *pPixelGroup, UINT32 Color)
 Adds the points in pPixelGroup to the already allocated image, only the positions contained in the pixelgroup will affect the image.

bool k_AddGroupToComplexImage (TComplexImage *pDest, const TPixelGroup *pPixelGroup, FLOAT32 Value)
 Adds the points in pPixelGroup to both the complex and the real part of the already allocated image, only the positions contained in the pixelgroup will affect the image.

 Adds the points in pPixelGroup of the already allocated image, only the positions contained in the pixelgroup will affect the image.

 Test if given position is included in the PixelGroup.

void k_PrintGroupInfo (const TPixelGroup *pPixelGroup, bool PrintPositions, unsigned int PosPrLine)
 Prints the information contained in "pPixelGroup" to stdout.

void k_GroupUpdateBoundaries (TPixelGroup *pPixelGroup)
 Runs through all positions in the group and update the left/right/top/bottom boundaries, this is usefull if you have used the fast functions which do not update boundary values.

Detailed Description

Kernel ANSI C pixel group functions, last updated 7/2/2002.

Works on TPixelGroup structure. These functions are part of the Image Processing Library IPL98.

Version:
1.41
Author:
René Dencker Eriksen (edr@mip.sdu.dk)

Function Documentation

bool k_AddColorsToGroup (  const TImage *    pSource,
TPixelGroup *    pPixelGroup
) 
 

After the creation of a PixelGroup this function will get the original pixel colors from given source image and insert them into the PixelGroup.

The pixel depth (b/p) from the source image is also stored in the pixel group. A call to the function k_CopyGroupToImage() will then produce an image with same pixel depth.

Parameters:
pSource  Image to get the original pixel values from. The PixelGroups positions must be derived from this image.
Returns :
False if the PixelGroup has no pixels in it, colors have already been added or one of the parameters is a NULL pointer.

Definition at line 615 of file kernel_pixelgroup.c.

References TPixelGroup::Bits, TImage::Bits, TPixelGroup::Bottom, TImage::Height, k_AddFileAndLine, k_AllocColorsGroup(), k_EmptyString(), k_GetPixelFast(), k_InitString(), k_ShowMessage(), TPixelGroup::Left, TPixelGroup::NumberOfPixels, TPixelGroup::pColor, TPixelGroup::pPos, TPixelGroup::Right, TPixelGroup::Top, TImage::Width, T2DInt::x, and T2DInt::y.

Referenced by k_AddColorsToGroups().

bool k_AddGroupColorsToImage (  TImage *    pDest,
const TPixelGroup *    pPixelGroup
) 
 

Adds the points in pPixelGroup to the already allocated image, only the positions contained in the pixelgroup will affect the image.

Positions outside image are ignored. The color values in the pixelgroup are used when inserting postitions, if you want the positions plotted with a constant color call the function k_AddGroupToImage(). Ensure that the bit depth (and palette if present) complies with the color values in the pixelgroup. The function will not do any tests for that. The function automaically does the copying as fast as possible by doing some range checks before entering the inner loops.

Parameters:
pDest  Image to plot points in, only pixels at positions contained in pixelgroup will affect the image.
pPixelGroup  The group of positions to be plotted in image.
Returns :
False, if pPixelgroup is NULL.
See also:
k_AddGroupToImage

Definition at line 1130 of file kernel_pixelgroup.c.

bool k_AddGroupToComplexImage (  TComplexImage *    pDest,
const TPixelGroup *    pPixelGroup,
FLOAT32    Value
) 
 

Adds the points in pPixelGroup to both the complex and the real part of the already allocated image, only the positions contained in the pixelgroup will affect the image.

Positions outside image are ignored. The function automaically does the copying as fast as possible by doing some range checks before entering the inner loops.

Parameters:
pDest  Image to plot points in, only pixels at positions contained in pixelgroup will affect the image.
pPixelGroup  The group of positions to be plotted in image.
Value  A FLOAT32 value containing the value.
Returns :
False, if pPixelgroup is NULL.

bool k_AddGroupToImage (  TImage *    pDest,
const TPixelGroup *    pPixelGroup,
UINT32    Color
) 
 

Adds the points in pPixelGroup to the already allocated image, only the positions contained in the pixelgroup will affect the image.

Positions outside image are ignored. If the pixelgroup contains color values they can be used as plotting values by calling the function k_AddGroupColorsToImage() instead. The function automaically does the copying as fast as possible by doing some range checks before entering the inner loops.

Parameters:
pDest  Image to plot points in, only pixels at positions contained in pixelgroup will affect the image.
pPixelGroup  The group of positions to be plotted in image.
Color  A UINT32 value containing the color, in case of a palette it is the index in the palette. If the group contains colors, you can use them by calling k_AddGroupColorsToImage() instead of this function.
Returns :
False, if pPixelgroup is NULL.
See also:
k_AddGroupColorsToImage

bool k_AddPosToGroup (  INT16    x,
INT16    y,
TPixelGroup *    pPixelGroup
) 
 

The position (x,y) is added to the group of pixels.

The function keeps track of allocation and updates the AllocatedPixels member in TPixelGroup. The boundary is also updated if the new position is outside the old boundary.

Parameters:
x  (INT16) Position in horisontal direction.
y  (INT16) Position in vertical direction.
Returns :
False, if colors are available, in that case the method does nothing.

References TPixelGroup::AllocatedPixels, TPixelGroup::Bottom, INT16, k_AddFileAndLine, k_EmptyString(), k_InitString(), k_ReAllocGroup(), k_ShowMessage(), TPixelGroup::Left, TPixelGroup::NumberOfPixels, TPixelGroup::pColor, TPixelGroup::pPos, TPixelGroup::Right, TPixelGroup::Top, T2DInt::x, and T2DInt::y.

void k_AdjustSizeOfGroup (  TPixelGroup *    pPixelGroup ) 
 

Removes unused memory allocated for pixel positions in the TPixelGroup structure.

If colors are available the color array will also be adjusted. Because memory allocation is a time consuming operation it is a good idea by each k_ReAllocGroup() (or k_AllocGroup()) call to allocate a big number of pixels and then at the end of the construction of a TPixelGroup calling this k_AdjustSizeOfGroup function to deallocate unused memory.

Definition at line 128 of file kernel_pixelgroup.c.

References TPixelGroup::AllocatedPixels, TPixelGroup::NumberOfPixels, TPixelGroup::pColor, TPixelGroup::pPos, and UINT32.

bool k_AllocAndInitColorsGroup (  UINT32    InitialValue,
TPixelGroup *    pPixelGroup
) 
 

Same as k_AllocColorsGroup but here the initial value of the allocated cells can be specified.

Note: If you later on call k_AddPosToGroup() or k_InsertPosInGroup() without adding a color, memory for previous allocated colors are deleted since the number of allocated colors does not equal number of positions. The functions takes care of it.

Parameters:
InitialValue  Initial value of allocated colors.
Returns :
False, if colors are allready available.
See also:
AllocColors

Definition at line 575 of file kernel_pixelgroup.c.

References TPixelGroup::AllocatedPixels, k_AddFileAndLine, k_AllocColorsGroup(), k_EmptyString(), k_InitString(), k_ShowMessage(), TPixelGroup::pColor, and UINT32.

bool k_AllocColorsGroup (  TPixelGroup *    pPixelGroup ) 
 

Allocates cells for color values but does not initialize the values.

Faster than using k_AllocAndInitColorsGroup(). Note: If you later on call k_AddPosToGroup() or k_InsertPosInGroup() without adding a color, memory for previous allocated colors are deleted since the number of allocated colors does not equal number of positions. The functions takes care of it.

Returns :
False, if colors are allready available.
See also:
AllocAndInitColors

void k_AllocGroup (  TPixelGroup *    pPixelGroup,
unsigned int    InitialSize
) 
 

Allocates memory for pixel positions in the TPixelGroup structure.

To make insertions fast, call this funcion with a value in InitialSize greater than the expected pixels in the group.

Parameters:
InitialSize  (unsigned int) Number of positions (T2DInt structures) to allocate memory for. Must be 1 or greater.

void k_CopyGroup (  TPixelGroup *    pDest,
const TPixelGroup *    pSource
) 
 

Copy whole group from "pSource" to "pDest".

The "pDest" parameter must point to an allocated and initialized TPixelGroup structure. Previous data in "pDest" are destroyed.

Definition at line 593 of file kernel_pixelgroup.c.

References TPixelGroup::AllocatedPixels, TPixelGroup::Bits, TPixelGroup::Bottom, TPixelGroup::Color, k_EmptyGroup(), TPixelGroup::Left, TPixelGroup::NumberOfPixels, TPixelGroup::pColor, TPixelGroup::pPos, TPixelGroup::Right, TPixelGroup::Top, and UINT32.

bool k_CopyGroupToImage (  TPalette *    pPalette,
UINT32    BackGround,
TImage *    pDest,
TPixelGroup *    pPixelGroup
) 
 

Copies a pixel group to a new image.

Origo of the new image is set to (-Left.x,-Top.y) which is the pixelgroups top left boundary. There are three cases which decides the bit depth of the output image: 1) No colors available (i.e. the function k_AddColorsToGroup() has not been called), then a black and white image with 1 b/p is produced and the positions are plotted in the image according to the "Color" member of the TPixelGroup-structure. If the Color-type is undefined the default is a white background with black pixels set at the given positions. 2) Colors available but no palette is given (i.e. pPalette is a NULL pointer), then an image with a graytone palette is produced if the Bits pixel depth member of TPixelGroup is 1 or 8. If the pixel depts is 24 b/p an image with 24 b/p without a palette is produced. 3) Colors available and a palette is provided. An image with pixel depth given in TPixelGroup and the given palette is produced. The pallette must correspond with the pixel depth in the TPixelGroup, otherwise an error message will be produced.

Parameters:
pPalette  The pallette to be used in the new image. If no colors are available or the pixel depth is 24 b/p this parameter is ignored. If the parameter is NULL a default palette is used (see case 2 above).
BackGround  The background color of new image, the user must be sure that the value in case of 1 or 8 b/p is in the range of the palette index and in case of 24 b/p the value must be the RGB color.
pDest  Image to copy the group to. All previous information in pDest is destroyed.
Returns :
False, if the pixel group is empty or "pDest" is a NULL pointer.

Definition at line 673 of file kernel_pixelgroup.c.

void k_EmptyGroup (  TPixelGroup *    pPixelGroup ) 
 

Deletes all allocated memory for PixelGroup and sets variables to 0.

Always call this function when leaving a scope where a TPixelGroup variable were created and used.

UINT32 k_GetColorGroup (  unsigned int    Index,
const TPixelGroup *    pPixelGroup
) 
 

Get the color corresponding to the position stored at "Index" in the group.

Maximum index is TPixelGroup.TotalPositions-1. There may not be any colors stored in the group, use k_ColorsAvailable() to check this.

Returns :
Position at given index, returns 0 if index is out of range or if colors are unavailable.

void k_InitGroup (  TPixelGroup *    pPixelGroup ) 
 

Sets all the pointers in pPixelGroup to NULL.

Initialises all integer to 0 and T2DInt members to (0,0). Always call this function when creating a variable of the TPixelGroup type

Parameters:
x  Position in horisontal direction.
y  Position in vertical direction.
Returns :
False, if colors are not available, in that case the function does nothing.
See also:
k_InsertPosColorInGroupFast

Definition at line 390 of file kernel_pixelgroup.c.

References INT16, k_Add2DPosColorToGroup(), k_AddFileAndLine, k_EmptyString(), k_InitString(), k_ShowMessage(), TPixelGroup::NumberOfPixels, TPixelGroup::pColor, TPixelGroup::pPos, UINT32, T2DInt::x, and T2DInt::y.

bool k_InsertPosInGroup (  INT16    x,
INT16    y,
unsigned int    Index,
TPixelGroup *    pPixelGroup
) 
 

Insert the position (x,y) at given Index, which must be less than the NumberOfPixels (stored in the TPixelGroup structure).

The ordering of the positions is preserved. If pixel colors are present in the TPixelGroup structure this function cannot be used. A call to k_RemoveColors() is then needed. The function k_AddColorsToGroup() can be called later to insert the colors again. The boundary is updated if the new position is outside the old boundary.

Parameters:
x  (INT16) Position in horisontal direction.
y  (INT16) Position in vertical direction.
Index  Index in the array of positions to be removed.
Returns :
False, if pixel colors are present (in the pColor array ot the TPixelGroup structure) or if Index is out of range.

bool k_PosInGroup (  const TPixelGroup *    pPixelGroup,
T2DInt    Pos,
unsigned int *    pIndex
) 
 

Test if given position is included in the PixelGroup.

Parameters:
Pos  Position to test for.
pIndex  If the position "pos" is found, the pIndex of the position is returned in this parameter. If not found, the parameter is unchanged.
Returns :
true if the position was found, false if not found or pPixelGroup is NULL.

void k_ReAllocGroup (  TPixelGroup *    pPixelGroup,
unsigned int    NewSize
) 
 

Reallocates memory for the TPixelGroup structure.

The new allocated memory is not initialised. If colors are available the color array will also be reallocated.

Parameters:
NewSize  (unsigned int) The new number of positions to allocate memory for. Note: The NewSize may be less than the actual allocated memory! In that case the corresponding positions stored in the end of the actual memory are deleted.

void k_RemoveColors (  TPixelGroup *    pPixelGroup ) 
 

Remove colors stored in the TPixelGroup.

If no colors are present, the function just returns without doing anything.

Definition at line 667 of file kernel_pixelgroup.c.

References TPixelGroup::pColor.

unsigned int k_RemoveDuplicatesFromGroup (  TPixelGroup *    pPixelGroup ) 
 

Removes duplicates of same position in given pixelgroup.

The algorithm could probably be more efficient but it is still nice to have this functionality. To make it a bit efficient though, the order of the positions is not preserved, i.e. the same code as k_RemovePosFromGroup is used to remove positions, but no update of boundary is neccesary.

Returns :
Total number of duplicate positions removed.

Definition at line 523 of file kernel_pixelgroup.c.

References TPixelGroup::NumberOfPixels, TPixelGroup::pColor, TPixelGroup::pPos, T2DInt::x, and T2DInt::y.

bool k_RemovePosFromGroup (  unsigned int    Index,
TPixelGroup *    pPixelGroup
) 
 

Remove a position stored in the group at given index.

Done by moving the last position in the pPos array contained in TPixelGroups to the index which is to be removed. If pixel colors are available in the TPixelGroup structure (in the pColor array), this array is updated. The boundary is also updated if the removed position causes changes in the boundary.

Parameters:
Index  Index in the array of position to be removed.
Returns :
False, if Index is out of range.
See also:
k_RemovePosFromGroupSlow

Definition at line 463 of file kernel_pixelgroup.c.

bool k_RemovePosFromGroupSlow (  unsigned int    Index,
TPixelGroup *    pPixelGroup
) 
 

Same as k_RemovePosFromGroup, but the ordering of the pixels is preserved.

This function is slower than k_RemovePosFromGroup.

Parameters:

Returns :
False, if Index is out of range.

bool k_SetColorGroup (  UINT32    ColorValue,
unsigned int    Index,
TPixelGroup *    pPixelGroup
) 
 

Set the color ColorValue corresponding to the position stored at "Index" in the group.

Maximum index is TPixelGroup.TotalPositions-1. There may not be any colors stored in the group, use k_ColorsAvailable() to check this.

Returns :
False, if index is out of range or if colors are unavailable.
